# Beads Workflow Context

> **Context Recovery**: Run `bd prime` after compaction, clear, or new session
> Hooks auto-call this in Claude Code when .beads/ detected

# üö® SESSION CLOSE PROTOCOL üö®

**CRITICAL**: Before saying "done" or "complete", you MUST run this checklist:

```
[ ] 1. git status              (check what changed)
[ ] 2. git add <files>         (stage code changes)
[ ] 3. bd sync --from-main     (pull beads updates from main)
[ ] 4. git commit -m "..."     (commit code changes)
```

**Note:** This is an ephemeral branch (no upstream). Code is merged to main locally, not pushed.

## Core Rules
- Track strategic work in beads (multi-session, dependencies, discovered work)
- Use `bd create` for issues, TodoWrite for simple single-session execution
- When in doubt, prefer bd‚Äîpersistence you don't need beats lost context
- Git workflow: hooks auto-sync, run `bd sync` at session end
- Session management: check `bd ready` for available work

## Essential Commands

### Finding Work
- `bd ready` - Show issues ready to work (no blockers)
- `bd list --status=open` - All open issues
- `bd list --status=in_progress` - Your active work
- `bd show <id>` - Detailed issue view with dependencies

### Creating & Updating
- `bd create --title="..." --type=task|bug|feature --priority=2` - New issue
  - Priority: 0-4 or P0-P4 (0=critical, 2=medium, 4=backlog). NOT "high"/"medium"/"low"
- `bd update <id> --status=in_progress` - Claim work
- `bd update <id> --assignee=username` - Assign to someone
- `bd close <id>` - Mark complete
- `bd close <id1> <id2> ...` - Close multiple issues at once (more efficient)
- `bd close <id> --reason="explanation"` - Close with reason
- **Tip**: When creating multiple issues/tasks/epics, use parallel subagents for efficiency

### Dependencies & Blocking
- `bd dep add <issue> <depends-on>` - Add dependency (issue depends on depends-on)
- `bd blocked` - Show all blocked issues
- `bd show <id>` - See what's blocking/blocked by this issue

### Sync & Collaboration
- `bd sync --from-main` - Pull beads updates from main (for ephemeral branches)
- `bd sync --status` - Check sync status without syncing

### Project Health
- `bd stats` - Project statistics (open/closed/blocked counts)
- `bd doctor` - Check for issues (sync problems, missing hooks)

## Common Workflows

**Starting work:**
```bash
bd ready           # Find available work
bd show <id>       # Review issue details
bd update <id> --status=in_progress  # Claim it
```

**Completing work:**
```bash
bd close <id1> <id2> ...    # Close all completed issues at once
bd sync --from-main         # Pull latest beads from main
git add . && git commit -m "..."  # Commit your changes
# Merge to main when ready (local merge, not push)
```

**Creating dependent work:**
```bash
# Run bd create commands in parallel (use subagents for many items)
bd create --title="Implement feature X" --type=feature
bd create --title="Write tests for X" --type=task
bd dep add beads-yyy beads-xxx  # Tests depend on Feature (Feature blocks tests)
```

file.content:
# Coding Agent Protocol

## Environment

All commands run inside Docker containers via `docker compose exec <service> <command>`.

**Start services with this command:**

```bash
# Always use development mode (code volume-mapped, hot reload enabled)
docker compose -f docker-compose.yml -f docker-compose.dev.yml up -d

# Verify running
curl -s http://localhost:8000/api/health | grep -q '"status":"ok"' && echo "Backend OK"
curl -s http://localhost:9200/_cluster/health | grep -q '"status"' && echo "OpenSearch OK"

# Run commands in containers
docker compose exec backend pytest tests/unit/test_video.py -v
docker compose exec backend alembic upgrade head
docker compose exec frontend npm test

# Stop services
docker compose down
```

Services: backend(:8000), frontend(:3000), postgres(:5432), opensearch(:9200), redis(:6379)

**Key Principle:** Edit code on host filesystem (not inside containers). Changes reflect immediately in running containers. No rebuild needed.

---

## Task Start

1. Run `bd show <feature-id>` and `bd show <task-id>` for context
2. If other tasks in the feature are already closed: review their descriptions to understand what's built
3. If current task has notes from previous agent: check `git status`, `git log`, review their progress
4. Run `bd update <task-id> --status=in_progress`

---

## During Work

- Commit incrementally after each logical unit of progress
- Reference task-id in commit messages

---

## Verification Loop

Before closing any task, you MUST verify your implementation works:

1. **Run the tests specified in the task description**
   ```bash
   docker compose exec backend pytest path/to/test.py -v
   ```

2. **If tests fail:**
   - Read the failure output carefully
   - Fix the issue in your code
   - Run the tests again
   - Repeat until all tests pass

3. **If no tests are specified, verify manually:**
   - For API endpoints: `curl` or use the API
   - For frontend components: check browser at localhost:3000
   - For models/migrations: verify with `alembic upgrade head`

4. **Only close the task when:**
   - All specified tests pass
   - No regressions in related tests
   - Code is committed

**Do NOT close a task with failing tests.** The tests are your signal that the implementation is correct.

---

## Task Complete

Before closing, ask yourself: **Did I take any shortcuts I know are suboptimal?**
(Missing error handling, hardcoded values, skipped validation, incomplete tests, TODO comments, etc.)

If yes: Either fix them now, or create a follow-up task to track the technical debt.

Only close when fully done (code works, tests pass, changes committed, no untracked shortcuts):
```bash
bd close <task-id>
```

---

## Context Limit Reached

If you cannot finish (read 10+ files, 15+ turns, task larger than expected):

1. Add handoff note to task:
   ```bash
   bd update <task-id> --description="[original description]

   ---
   Handoff: Completed X. Remaining: Y. Modified: file1, file2."
   ```

2. Commit with message noting partial progress
3. Leave task open and exit

---

## Rules

- Only work on your assigned task - do not start additional tasks
- Exit after completing (or handing off) your assigned task
- Never close incomplete tasks
- Never close tasks with failing tests
- Never redo work previous agents committed
- Never change Docker image versions (specified in "Docker Image Versions" section in docs/design/technology-stack.md)
- Tasks should modify 1-3 files, read 5-8 max

Description:
# Feature: Project Scaffolding & Infrastructure

## Overview
Set up the foundational project structure, Docker infrastructure, database models, migrations, and configuration. This is the prerequisite for all other Phase 1 features - it establishes the backend/frontend project skeletons, Docker Compose services, PostgreSQL schema, OpenSearch client, Redis/Celery config, and health check endpoint.

## User Stories Covered
None directly - this is foundational infrastructure that enables V1, V2, V3, P1, P2, P3, S1, S3, M1.

## Technical Context

### Files to Create
- `docker-compose.yml` - All services (postgres, opensearch, redis, backend, celery-worker, frontend)
- `docker-compose.dev.yml` - Development overrides (hot reload, volume mounts)
- `.env.example` - Environment variable template
- `backend/Dockerfile` - Python 3.11 + FFmpeg + system deps
- `backend/requirements.txt` - Phase 1 Python dependencies (pinned versions)
- `backend/alembic.ini` - Alembic configuration
- `backend/app/__init__.py` - Package init
- `backend/app/main.py` - FastAPI application entry with CORS, router mounting, health endpoint
- `backend/app/core/__init__.py` - Core package init
- `backend/app/core/config.py` - Settings via pydantic-settings (DATABASE_URL, OPENSEARCH_URL, REDIS_URL, etc.)
- `backend/app/core/database.py` - SQLAlchemy async engine, session factory, Base model
- `backend/app/core/opensearch.py` - OpenSearch client singleton
- `backend/app/models/__init__.py` - Models package init
- `backend/app/models/video.py` - Video SQLAlchemy model (id, title, file_path, processed_path, thumbnail_path, duration, recording_date, participants[], context_notes, status, error_message, created_at, updated_at)
- `backend/app/models/transcript.py` - Transcript model (id, video_id FK, full_text, language, word_count, created_at)
- `backend/app/models/segment.py` - Segment model (id, transcript_id FK, video_id FK, start_time, end_time, text, speaker, chunking_method, embedding_indexed, created_at)
- `backend/app/migrations/versions/001_initial.py` - Initial Alembic migration creating videos, transcripts, segments tables
- `backend/app/schemas/__init__.py` - Schemas package init
- `backend/app/api/__init__.py` - API package init
- `backend/app/api/deps.py` - Dependency injection (get_db session)
- `backend/app/api/routes/__init__.py` - Routes package init
- `backend/app/tasks/__init__.py` - Tasks package init
- `backend/app/tasks/celery_app.py` - Celery configuration with Redis broker
- `backend/app/services/__init__.py` - Services package init
- `frontend/Dockerfile` - Node.js 20 + Vite build + Nginx serve
- `frontend/package.json` - Phase 1 dependencies (react, react-dom, react-router-dom, axios, video.js, typescript, vite, tailwindcss, vitest)
- `frontend/vite.config.ts` - Vite config with React plugin, proxy to backend
- `frontend/tailwind.config.js` - Tailwind configuration
- `frontend/tsconfig.json` - TypeScript config
- `frontend/src/main.tsx` - React entry point
- `frontend/src/App.tsx` - Router setup with routes for /, /upload, /videos/:id, /search
- `frontend/src/api/client.ts` - Axios instance with base URL config
- `frontend/src/styles/index.css` - Tailwind imports
- `frontend/src/types/video.ts` - Video, Transcript, Segment TypeScript types
- `frontend/src/types/search.ts` - Search request/response types
- `frontend/index.html` - HTML entry point
- `data/videos/original/.gitkeep` - Directory structure
- `data/videos/processed/.gitkeep`
- `data/videos/audio/.gitkeep`
- `data/videos/thumbnails/.gitkeep`
- `data/transcripts/.gitkeep`

### Dependencies
- Docker and Docker Compose installed on host
- Python 3.11, Node.js 20.x LTS
- See docs/design/technology-stack.md for all pinned versions

### Key Design Decisions
- PostgreSQL 16.1 as source of truth; OpenSearch 2.11.1 as derived search index
- Redis 7.2.4 as Celery broker
- FastAPI with pydantic-settings for config
- SQLAlchemy 2.0 with async support
- Alembic for migrations
- Vite + React 18 + TypeScript + Tailwind CSS for frontend
- Video.js 8.6 for HTML5 player (Phase 5 - P1 feature)
- All services run in Docker containers; dev overrides mount source for hot reload

## Implementation Notes
- Use the exact versions from docs/design/technology-stack.md
- Backend Dockerfile needs FFmpeg installed (apt-get install ffmpeg)
- OpenSearch must have security plugin disabled for dev (DISABLE_SECURITY_PLUGIN=true)
- Database URL format: postgresql://whedifaqaui:password@postgres:5432/whedifaqaui
- Health endpoint should check postgres and opensearch connectivity
- Celery worker uses same Docker image as backend, different CMD
- Frontend Dockerfile: multi-stage build (node for build, nginx for serve)
- GPU support in docker-compose for CUDA-accelerated transcription (optional for dev)
- Status enum values: uploaded, processing, transcribing, chunking, indexing, ready, error

## Testing Requirements

### Test Specification Reference
- Document: docs/testing/phase1-test-specification.md
- Sections: All sections (this feature provides infrastructure for all tests)

### Unit Tests
- V3-U01: test_status_enum_values - verify all status values are defined

### Integration Tests
- Health endpoint returns 200 with status ok
- Database connection works
- OpenSearch client connects

### E2E Scenarios
- No E2E scenarios directly - this feature enables all subsequent E2E tests

### Quality Gate
This feature is NOT complete until:
- docker compose up -d starts all services without errors
- curl localhost:8000/api/health returns {"status":"ok"}
- curl localhost:9200/_cluster/health returns cluster status
- Alembic migration creates all 3 tables (videos, transcripts, segments)
- Frontend dev server starts at localhost:3000
- React app renders with router (shows placeholder pages)

## Reference Documentation
- docs/design/technology-stack.md - All pinned versions and package lists
- docs/design/data-model.md - PostgreSQL schema and OpenSearch index definitions
- docs/design/deployment.md - Docker Compose configuration
- docs/implementation/phase1.md - Project structure and component specs

- `frontend/src/App.tsx` - Router setup with routes for /, /upload, /videos/:id, /search
- `frontend/src/api/client.ts` - Axios instance with base URL config
- `frontend/src/styles/index.css` - Tailwind imports
- `frontend/src/types/video.ts` - Video, Transcript, Segment TypeScript types
- `frontend/src/types/search.ts` - Search request/response types
- `frontend/index.html` - HTML entry point
- `data/videos/original/.gitkeep` - Directory structure
- `data/videos/processed/.gitkeep`
- `data/videos/audio/.gitkeep`
- `data/videos/thumbnails/.gitkeep`
- `data/transcripts/.gitkeep`

### Dependencies
- Docker and Docker Compose installed on host
- Python 3.11, Node.js 20.x LTS
- See docs/design/technology-stack.md for all pinned versions

### Key Design Decisions
- PostgreSQL 16.1 as source of truth; OpenSearch 2.11.1 as derived search index
- Redis 7.2.4 as Celery broker
- FastAPI with pydantic-settings for config
- SQLAlchemy 2.0 with async support
- Alembic for migrations
- Vite + React 18 + TypeScript + Tailwind CSS for frontend
- Video.js 8.6 for HTML5 player (Phase 5 - P1 feature)
- All services run in Docker containers; dev overrides mount source for hot reload

## Implementation Notes
- Use the exact versions from docs/design/technology-stack.md
- Backend Dockerfile needs FFmpeg installed (apt-get install ffmpeg)
- OpenSearch must have security plugin disabled for dev (DISABLE_SECURITY_PLUGIN=true)
- Database URL format: postgresql://whedifaqaui:password@postgres:5432/whedifaqaui
- Health endpoint should check postgres and opensearch connectivity
- Celery worker uses same Docker image as backend, different CMD
- Frontend Dockerfile: multi-stage build (node for build, nginx for serve)
- GPU support in docker-compose for CUDA-accelerated transcription (optional for dev)
- Status enum values: uploaded, processing, transcribing, chunking, indexing, ready, error

## Testing Requirements

### Test Specification Reference
- Document: docs/testing/phase1-test-specification.md
- Sections: All sections (this feature provides infrastructure for all tests)

### Unit Tests
- V3-U01: test_status_enum_values - verify all status values are defined

### Integration Tests
- Health endpoint returns 200 with status ok
- Database connection works
- OpenSearch client connects

### E2E Scenarios
- No E2E scenarios directly - this feature enables all subsequent E2E tests

### Quality Gate
This feature is NOT complete until:
- docker compose up -d starts all services without errors
- curl localhost:8000/api/health returns {"status":"ok"}
- curl localhost:9200/_cluster/health returns cluster status
- Alembic migration creates all 3 tables (videos, transcripts, segments)
- Frontend dev server starts at localhost:3000
- React app renders with router (shows placeholder pages)

## Reference Documentation
- docs/design/technology-stack.md - All pinned versions and package lists
- docs/design/data-model.md - PostgreSQL schema and OpenSearch index definitions
- docs/design/deployment.md - Docker Compose configuration
- docs/implementation/phase1.md - Project structure and component specs

## Objective
Create the three Phase 1 SQLAlchemy models matching the PostgreSQL schema from the data model design.

## Files to Create
- `backend/app/models/__init__.py` - Import and export all models
- `backend/app/models/video.py` - Video model
- `backend/app/models/transcript.py` - Transcript model
- `backend/app/models/segment.py` - Segment model

- `backend/app/core/database.py` - Base model class (from previous task)
- `docs/implementation/phase1.md` - Model field reference

## Implementation Details
Use SQLAlchemy 2.0 style with Mapped and mapped_column.

Video model fields: id (UUID PK, server_default=text('gen_random_uuid()')), title (String(255), NOT NULL), file_path (String(500), NOT NULL), processed_path (String(500), nullable), thumbnail_path (String(500), nullable), duration (Integer, nullable), recording_date (Date, NOT NULL), participants (ARRAY(Text), nullable), context_notes (Text, nullable), status (String(50), NOT NULL, default='uploaded'), error_message (Text, nullable), created_at (DateTime with TZ, server_default), updated_at (DateTime with TZ, server_default, onupdate)

Status values: uploaded, processing, transcribing, chunking, indexing, ready, error

Transcript model fields: id (UUID PK), video_id (UUID FK videos.id ON DELETE CASCADE), full_text (Text NOT NULL), language (String(10) default 'en'), word_count (Integer nullable), created_at (DateTime with TZ). UniqueConstraint on video_id.

Segment model fields: id (UUID PK), transcript_id (UUID FK transcripts.id ON DELETE CASCADE), video_id (UUID FK videos.id ON DELETE CASCADE), start_time (Float NOT NULL), end_time (Float NOT NULL), text (Text NOT NULL), speaker (String(100) nullable), chunking_method (String(20) default 'embedding'), embedding_indexed (Boolean default False), created_at (DateTime with TZ)

Add indexes: idx_videos_status, idx_videos_recording_date, idx_segments_video_id, idx_segments_transcript_id, idx_segments_time (video_id, start_time)

models/__init__.py should import Video, Transcript, Segment from their modules.

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] All three models defined with correct fields and types
- [ ] Foreign key relationships set up
- [ ] Indexes defined
- [ ] Models exported from __init__.py

```bash
docker compose exec backend python -c "from app.models import Video, Transcript, Segment; print('Models OK')"
```

from sqlalchemy import create_engine
from sqlalchemy.orm import DeclarativeBase, sessionmaker

from app.core.config import settings

engine = create_engine(
    settings.DATABASE_URL,
    pool_pre_ping=True,
    pool_size=5,
    max_overflow=10,
)

SessionLocal = sessionmaker(
    autocommit=False, autoflush=False, expire_on_commit=False, bind=engine
)


class Base(DeclarativeBase):
    pass


def get_db():
    """Dependency for FastAPI routes to get a database session."""
    db = SessionLocal()
    try:
        yield db
    finally:
        db.close()

1‚Üí# Data Model
     2‚Üí
     3‚Üí## Overview
     4‚Üí
     5‚ÜíWhedifaqaui uses a dual-database architecture:
     6‚Üí- **PostgreSQL**: Source of truth for all structured data
     7‚Üí- **OpenSearch**: Search indices optimized for hybrid retrieval
     8‚Üí
     9‚ÜíData flows from PostgreSQL to OpenSearch during the indexing phase.
    10‚Üí
    11‚Üí### Tables by Phase
    12‚Üí
    13‚Üí| Table | Phase | Description |
    14‚Üí|-------|-------|-------------|
    15‚Üí| `videos` | 1 | Video metadata and processing status |
    16‚Üí| `transcripts` | 1 | Full transcript text per video |
    17‚Üí| `segments` | 1 | Chunked transcript segments with speaker labels |
    18‚Üí| `system_settings` | 1 | Configurable system settings |
    19‚Üí| `generated_documents` | 2 | AI-generated summary documents |
    20‚Üí| `entities` | 3 | Extracted entities (people, systems, projects) |
    21‚Üí| `entity_mentions` | 3 | Links entities to segments |
    22‚Üí| `entity_relationships` | 3 | Relationships between entities |
    23‚Üí| `topics` | 3 | Extracted topics/concepts |
    24‚Üí| `topic_mentions` | 3 | Links topics to segments |
    25‚Üí| `speaker_mappings` | 3 | Maps SPEAKER_00 ‚Üí actual names |
    26‚Üí| `screenshots` | 3 | Critical frame captures with descriptions |
    27‚Üí| `user_comments` | 6 | User annotations on videos |
    28‚Üí| `conversations` | 7 | Saved conversation sessions |
    29‚Üí| `conversation_messages` | 7 | Messages within conversations |
    30‚Üí
    31‚Üí## PostgreSQL Schema
    32‚Üí
    33‚Üí### Entity Relationship Diagram
    34‚Üí
    35‚Üí```

    37‚Üí‚îÇ     videos      ‚îÇ       ‚îÇ     transcripts     ‚îÇ       ‚îÇ    segments     ‚îÇ
    38‚Üí‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚î§       ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚î§       ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚î§
    39‚Üí‚îÇ id (PK)         ‚îÇ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ<‚îÇ id (PK)             ‚îÇ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ<‚îÇ id (PK)         ‚îÇ
    40‚Üí‚îÇ title           ‚îÇ       ‚îÇ video_id (FK)       ‚îÇ       ‚îÇ transcript_id   ‚îÇ
    41‚Üí‚îÇ file_path       ‚îÇ       ‚îÇ full_text           ‚îÇ       ‚îÇ start_time      ‚îÇ
    42‚Üí‚îÇ processed_path  ‚îÇ       ‚îÇ language            ‚îÇ       ‚îÇ end_time        ‚îÇ
    43‚Üí‚îÇ duration        ‚îÇ       ‚îÇ created_at          ‚îÇ       ‚îÇ text            ‚îÇ
    44‚Üí‚îÇ recording_date  ‚îÇ       ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îò       ‚îÇ speaker         ‚îÇ
    45‚Üí‚îÇ participants    ‚îÇ                                     ‚îÇ embedding_id    ‚îÇ

    47‚Üí‚îÇ status          ‚îÇ                                              ‚îÇ

    52‚Üí                          ‚îÇ id (PK)             ‚îÇ                ‚îÇ

   127‚Üí### Table Definitions
   128‚Üí
   129‚Üí#### videos (Phase 1)
   130‚Üí
   131‚Üí```sql
   132‚ÜíCREATE TABLE videos (
   133‚Üí    id UUID PRIMARY KEY DEFAULT gen_random_uuid(),
   134‚Üí    title VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL,
   135‚Üí    file_path VARCHAR(500) NOT NULL,
   136‚Üí    processed_path VARCHAR(500),
   137‚Üí    thumbnail_path VARCHAR(500),
   138‚Üí    duration INTEGER,  -- seconds
   139‚Üí    recording_date DATE NOT NULL,
   140‚Üí    participants TEXT[],  -- array of names
   141‚Üí    context_notes TEXT,
   142‚Üí    status VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL DEFAULT 'uploaded',
   143‚Üí    -- status: uploaded, processing, transcribing, analyzing, ready, error
   144‚Üí    error_message TEXT,
   145‚Üí    created_at TIMESTAMP WITH TIME ZONE DEFAULT NOW(),
   146‚Üí    updated_at TIMESTAMP WITH TIME ZONE DEFAULT NOW()
   147‚Üí);
   148‚Üí
   149‚ÜíCREATE INDEX idx_videos_status ON videos(status);
   150‚ÜíCREATE INDEX idx_videos_recording_date ON videos(recording_date);
   151‚Üí```
   152‚Üí
   153‚Üí#### transcripts (Phase 1)
   154‚Üí
   155‚Üí```sql
   156‚ÜíCREATE TABLE transcripts (
   157‚Üí    id UUID PRIMARY KEY DEFAULT gen_random_uuid(),
   158‚Üí    video_id UUID NOT NULL REFERENCES videos(id) ON DELETE CASCADE,
   159‚Üí    full_text TEXT NOT NULL,
   160‚Üí    language VARCHAR(10) DEFAULT 'en',
   161‚Üí    word_count INTEGER,
   162‚Üí    created_at TIMESTAMP WITH TIME ZONE DEFAULT NOW(),
   163‚Üí
   164‚Üí    UNIQUE(video_id)
   165‚Üí);
   166‚Üí```
   167‚Üí
   168‚Üí#### segments (Phase 1)
   169‚Üí
   170‚Üí```sql
   171‚ÜíCREATE TABLE segments (
   172‚Üí    id UUID PRIMARY KEY DEFAULT gen_random_uuid(),
   173‚Üí    transcript_id UUID NOT NULL REFERENCES transcripts(id) ON DELETE CASCADE,
   174‚Üí    video_id UUID NOT NULL REFERENCES videos(id) ON DELETE CASCADE,
   175‚Üí    start_time FLOAT NOT NULL,  -- seconds
   176‚Üí    end_time FLOAT NOT NULL,    -- seconds
   177‚Üí    text TEXT NOT NULL,
   178‚Üí    summary TEXT,  -- LLM-generated summary (if enabled, Phase 2+)
   179‚Üí    speaker VARCHAR(100),  -- WhisperX speaker label: SPEAKER_00, SPEAKER_01, etc.
   180‚Üí    chunking_method VARCHAR(20) DEFAULT 'embedding',  -- 'embedding' or 'llm'
   181‚Üí    embedding_indexed BOOLEAN DEFAULT FALSE,
   182‚Üí    created_at TIMESTAMP WITH TIME ZONE DEFAULT NOW()
   183‚Üí);
   184‚Üí
   185‚ÜíCREATE INDEX idx_segments_video_id ON segments(video_id);
   186‚ÜíCREATE INDEX idx_segments_transcript_id ON segments(transcript_id);
   187‚ÜíCREATE INDEX idx_segments_time ON segments(video_id, start_time);
   188‚ÜíCREATE INDEX idx_segments_chunking_method ON segments(chunking_method);
   189‚Üí```
   190‚Üí
   191‚Üí#### entities (Phase 3)
   192‚Üí
   193‚Üí```sql
   194‚ÜíCREATE TYPE entity_type AS ENUM ('person', 'system', 'project', 'organization', 'concept', 'date', 'other');
   195‚Üí
   196‚ÜíCREATE TABLE entities (
   197‚Üí    id UUID PRIMARY KEY DEFAULT gen_random_uuid(),
   198‚Üí    name VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL,
   199‚Üí    canonical_name VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL,  -- normalized form
   200‚Üí    type entity_type NOT NULL,
   201‚Üí    description TEXT,
   202‚Üí    aliases TEXT[],  -- alternative names that map to this entity
   203‚Üí    first_seen DATE,
   204‚Üí    last_seen DATE,
   205‚Üí    mention_count INTEGER DEFAULT 0,
   206‚Üí    created_at TIMESTAMP WITH TIME ZONE DEFAULT NOW(),
   207‚Üí    updated_at TIMESTAMP WITH TIME ZONE DEFAULT NOW(),
   208‚Üí
   209‚Üí    UNIQUE(canonical_name, type)
   210‚Üí);
   211‚Üí
   212‚ÜíCREATE INDEX idx_entities_type ON entities(type);
   213‚ÜíCREATE INDEX idx_entities_canonical ON entities(canonical_name);
   214‚Üí```
   215‚Üí
   216‚Üí#### entity_mentions (Phase 3)
   217‚Üí
   218‚Üí```sql
   219‚ÜíCREATE TABLE entity_mentions (
   220‚Üí    id UUID PRIMARY KEY DEFAULT gen_random_uuid(),
   221‚Üí    entity_id UUID NOT NULL REFERENCES entities(id) ON DELETE CASCADE,
   222‚Üí    segment_id UUID NOT NULL REFERENCES segments(id) ON DELETE CASCADE,
   223‚Üí    video_id UUID NOT NULL REFERENCES videos(id) ON DELETE CASCADE,
   224‚Üí    timestamp FLOAT NOT NULL,  -- seconds into video
   225‚Üí    confidence FLOAT DEFAULT 1.0,
   226‚Üí    created_at TIMESTAMP WITH TIME ZONE DEFAULT NOW()
   227‚Üí);
   228‚Üí
   229‚ÜíCREATE INDEX idx_entity_mentions_entity ON entity_mentions(entity_id);
   230‚ÜíCREATE INDEX idx_entity_mentions_segment ON entity_mentions(segment_id);
   231‚ÜíCREATE INDEX idx_entity_mentions_video ON entity_mentions(video_id);
   232‚Üí```
   233‚Üí
   234‚Üí#### entity_relationships (Phase 3)
   235‚Üí
   236‚Üí```sql
   237‚ÜíCREATE TABLE entity_relationships (
   238‚Üí    id UUID PRIMARY KEY DEFAULT gen_random_uuid(),
   239‚Üí    source_entity_id UUID NOT NULL REFERENCES entities(id) ON DELETE CASCADE,
   240‚Üí    target_entity_id UUID NOT NULL REFERENCES entities(id) ON DELETE CASCADE,
   241‚Üí    relation_type VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL,
   242‚Üí    -- e.g., "migrated_from", "replaced_by", "explained_by", "part_of", "works_with"
   243‚Üí    video_id UUID REFERENCES videos(id) ON DELETE SET NULL,
   244‚Üí    timestamp FLOAT,
   245‚Üí    confidence FLOAT DEFAULT 1.0,
   246‚Üí    created_at TIMESTAMP WITH TIME ZONE DEFAULT NOW(),
   247‚Üí
   248‚Üí    UNIQUE(source_entity_id, target_entity_id, relation_type)
   249‚Üí);
   250‚Üí
   251‚ÜíCREATE INDEX idx_entity_rel_source ON entity_relationships(source_entity_id);
   252‚ÜíCREATE INDEX idx_entity_rel_target ON entity_relationships(target_entity_id);
   253‚ÜíCREATE INDEX idx_entity_rel_type ON entity_relationships(relation_type);
   254‚Üí```
   255‚Üí
   256‚Üí#### topics (Phase 3)
   257‚Üí
   258‚Üí```sql
   259‚ÜíCREATE TABLE topics (
   260‚Üí    id UUID PRIMARY KEY DEFAULT gen_random_uuid(),
   261‚Üí    name VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL UNIQUE,
   262‚Üí    description TEXT,
   263‚Üí    parent_topic_id UUID REFERENCES topics(id) ON DELETE SET NULL,
   264‚Üí    created_at TIMESTAMP WITH TIME ZONE DEFAULT NOW()
   265‚Üí);
   266‚Üí
   267‚ÜíCREATE INDEX idx_topics_parent ON topics(parent_topic_id);
   268‚Üí```
   269‚Üí
   270‚Üí#### topic_mentions (Phase 3)
   271‚Üí
   272‚Üí```sql
   273‚ÜíCREATE TABLE topic_mentions (
   274‚Üí    id UUID PRIMARY KEY DEFAULT gen_random_uuid(),
   275‚Üí    topic_id UUID NOT NULL REFERENCES topics(id) ON DELETE CASCADE,
   276‚Üí    segment_id UUID NOT NULL REFERENCES segments(id) ON DELETE CASCADE,
   277‚Üí    video_id UUID NOT NULL REFERENCES videos(id) ON DELETE CASCADE,
   278‚Üí    timestamp FLOAT NOT NULL,
   279‚Üí    created_at TIMESTAMP WITH TIME ZONE DEFAULT NOW()
   280‚Üí);
   281‚Üí
   282‚ÜíCREATE INDEX idx_topic_mentions_topic ON topic_mentions(topic_id);
   283‚ÜíCREATE INDEX idx_topic_mentions_video ON topic_mentions(video_id);
   284‚Üí```
   285‚Üí
   286‚Üí#### speaker_mappings (Phase 3)
   287‚Üí
   288‚ÜíMaps WhisperX speaker labels (SPEAKER_00) to inferred or user-corrected names.
   289‚Üí
   290‚Üí```sql
   291‚ÜíCREATE TABLE speaker_mappings (
   292‚Üí    id UUID PRIMARY KEY DEFAULT gen_random_uuid(),
   293‚Üí    video_id UUID NOT NULL REFERENCES videos(id) ON DELETE CASCADE,
   294‚Üí    speaker_label VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,   -- SPEAKER_00, SPEAKER_01, etc.
   295‚Üí    speaker_name VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL,   -- John Smith, Sarah Chen, etc.
   296‚Üí    confidence FLOAT DEFAULT 1.0,         -- Claude's confidence in the mapping
   297‚Üí    source VARCHAR(20) DEFAULT 'claude',  -- 'claude' or 'manual'
   298‚Üí    created_at TIMESTAMP WITH TIME ZONE DEFAULT NOW(),
   299‚Üí    updated_at TIMESTAMP WITH TIME ZONE DEFAULT NOW(),
   300‚Üí
   301‚Üí    UNIQUE(video_id, speaker_label)
   302‚Üí);
   303‚Üí
   304‚ÜíCREATE INDEX idx_speaker_mappings_video ON speaker_mappings(video_id);
   305‚Üí```
   306‚Üí
   307‚Üí#### screenshots (Phase 3)
   308‚Üí
   309‚ÜíCritical frames extracted from videos with Claude-generated descriptions.
   310‚Üí
   311‚Üí```sql
   312‚ÜíCREATE TABLE screenshots (
   313‚Üí    id UUID PRIMARY KEY DEFAULT gen_random_uuid(),
   314‚Üí    video_id UUID NOT NULL REFERENCES videos(id) ON DELETE CASCADE,
   315‚Üí    timestamp FLOAT NOT NULL,
   316‚Üí    file_path VARCHAR(500) NOT NULL,
   317‚Üí    thumbnail_path VARCHAR(500),
   318‚Üí    reason TEXT,              -- Why Claude flagged this frame as critical
   319‚Üí    content_type VARCHAR(50), -- diagram, code, slide, terminal, etc.
   320‚Üí    extracted_text TEXT,      -- Text visible in image (extracted by Claude)
   321‚Üí    description TEXT,         -- Claude's visual description
   322‚Üí    technical_details TEXT[], -- Technical concepts identified
   323‚Üí    created_at TIMESTAMP WITH TIME ZONE DEFAULT NOW()
   324‚Üí);
   325‚Üí
   326‚ÜíCREATE INDEX idx_screenshots_video ON screenshots(video_id);
   327‚ÜíCREATE INDEX idx_screenshots_video_time ON screenshots(video_id, timestamp);
   328‚ÜíCREATE INDEX idx_screenshots_content_type ON screenshots(content_type);
   329‚Üí```
   330‚Üí
   331‚Üí#### generated_documents (Phase 2)
   332‚Üí
   333‚ÜíAI-generated summary documents from chat sessions.
   334‚Üí
   335‚Üí```sql
   336‚ÜíCREATE TABLE generated_documents (
   337‚Üí    id UUID PRIMARY KEY DEFAULT gen_random_uuid(),
   338‚Üí    session_id VARCHAR(100),  -- Browser session or user session
   339‚Üí    title VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL,
   340‚Üí    content TEXT NOT NULL,    -- Markdown content
   341‚Üí    source_segment_ids UUID[],  -- Segments used to generate
   342‚Üí    source_video_ids UUID[],    -- Videos referenced
   343‚Üí    created_at TIMESTAMP WITH TIME ZONE DEFAULT NOW()
   344‚Üí);
   345‚Üí
   346‚ÜíCREATE INDEX idx_documents_session ON generated_documents(session_id);
   347‚Üí```
   348‚Üí
   349‚Üí#### system_settings (Phase 1)
   350‚Üí
   351‚Üí```sql
   352‚ÜíCREATE TABLE system_settings (
   353‚Üí    key VARCHAR(100) PRIMARY KEY,
   354‚Üí    value JSONB NOT NULL,
   355‚Üí    updated_at TIMESTAMP WITH TIME ZONE DEFAULT NOW()
   356‚Üí);
   357‚Üí
   358‚Üí-- Default settings inserted on system initialization
   359‚ÜíINSERT INTO system_settings (key, value) VALUES
   360‚Üí    ('chunking', '{
   361‚Üí        "mode": "embedding",
   362‚Üí        "embedding": {
   363‚Üí            "similarity_threshold": 0.5,
   364‚Üí            "min_chunk_tokens": 100,
   365‚Üí            "max_chunk_tokens": 500
   366‚Üí        },
   367‚Üí        "llm": {
   368‚Üí            "include_summaries": true
   369‚Üí        }
   370‚Üí    }'),
   371‚Üí    ('analysis', '{
   372‚Üí        "entity_extraction": {
   373‚Üí            "enabled": true,
   374‚Üí            "extract_relationships": true
   375‚Üí        },
   376‚Üí        "summaries": {
   377‚Üí            "generate": false,
   378‚Üí            "embed": false
   379‚Üí        }
   380‚Üí    }'),
   381‚Üí    ('whisperx', '{
   382‚Üí        "model": "large-v2",
   383‚Üí        "device": "cuda",
   384‚Üí        "compute_type": "float16",
   385‚Üí        "language": "en",
   386‚Üí        "batch_size": 16
   387‚Üí    }'),
   388‚Üí    -- Note: Speaker diarization is always enabled (built into WhisperX)
   389‚Üí    ('search', '{
   390‚Üí        "default_mode": "quick",
   391‚Üí        "results_per_query": 10,
   392‚Üí        "hybrid_weight": 0.5
   393‚Üí    }');
   394‚Üí```
   395‚Üí
   396‚Üí---
   397‚Üí
   398‚Üí## OpenSearch Indices
   399‚Üí
   400‚Üí### segments_index (Phase 1, extended Phase 3)
   401‚Üí
   402‚ÜíPrimary index for hybrid search over transcript segments.
   403‚Üí
   404‚Üí**Phase 1 fields**: id, video_id, video_title, transcript_id, text, embedding, start_time, end_time, speaker, recording_date, created_at
   405‚Üí
   406‚Üí**Phase 3 additions**: entities, entity_types, topics
   407‚Üí
   408‚Üí```json
   409‚Üí{
   410‚Üí  "mappings": {
   411‚Üí    "properties": {
   412‚Üí      "id": { "type": "keyword" },
   413‚Üí      "video_id": { "type": "keyword" },
   414‚Üí      "video_title": { "type": "text" },
   415‚Üí      "transcript_id": { "type": "keyword" },
   416‚Üí
   417‚Üí      "text": {
   418‚Üí        "type": "text",
   419‚Üí        "analyzer": "english"
   420‚Üí      },
   421‚Üí
   422‚Üí      "embedding": {
   423‚Üí        "type": "knn_vector",
   424‚Üí        "dimension": 768,
   425‚Üí        "method": {
   426‚Üí          "name": "hnsw",
   427‚Üí          "space_type": "cosinesimil",
   428‚Üí          "engine": "lucene",
   429‚Üí          "parameters": {
   430‚Üí            "ef_construction": 128,
   431‚Üí            "m": 16
   432‚Üí          }
   433‚Üí        }
   434‚Üí      },
   435‚Üí
   436‚Üí      "start_time": { "type": "float" },
   437‚Üí      "end_time": { "type": "float" },
   438‚Üí      "speaker": { "type": "keyword" },
   439‚Üí
   440‚Üí      "entities": { "type": "keyword" },
   441‚Üí      "entity_types": { "type": "keyword" },
   442‚Üí      "topics": { "type": "keyword" },
   443‚Üí
   444‚Üí      "recording_date": { "type": "date" },
   445‚Üí      "created_at": { "type": "date" }
   446‚Üí    }
   447‚Üí  },
   448‚Üí  "settings": {
   449‚Üí    "index": {
   450‚Üí      "knn": true,
   451‚Üí      "number_of_shards": 1,
   452‚Üí      "number_of_replicas": 0
   453‚Üí    }
   454‚Üí  }
   455‚Üí}
   456‚Üí```
   457‚Üí
   458‚Üí### entities_index (Phase 3)
   459‚Üí
   460‚ÜíIndex for entity search and discovery. Created in Phase 3 when entity extraction is added.
   461‚Üí
   462‚Üí```json
   463‚Üí{
   464‚Üí  "mappings": {
   465‚Üí    "properties": {
   466‚Üí      "id": { "type": "keyword" },
   467‚Üí      "name": { "type": "text" },
   468‚Üí      "canonical_name": { "type": "keyword" },
   469‚Üí      "type": { "type": "keyword" },
   470‚Üí      "description": { "type": "text" },
   471‚Üí      "aliases": { "type": "keyword" },
   472‚Üí
   473‚Üí      "description_embedding": {
   474‚Üí        "type": "knn_vector",
   475‚Üí        "dimension": 768,
   476‚Üí        "method": {
   477‚Üí          "name": "hnsw",
   478‚Üí          "space_type": "cosinesimil",
   479‚Üí          "engine": "lucene"
   480‚Üí        }
   481‚Üí      },
   482‚Üí
   483‚Üí      "mention_count": { "type": "integer" },
   484‚Üí      "first_seen": { "type": "date" },
   485‚Üí      "last_seen": { "type": "date" },
   486‚Üí
   487‚Üí      "video_ids": { "type": "keyword" }
   488‚Üí    }
   489‚Üí  },
   490‚Üí  "settings": {
   491‚Üí    "index": {
   492‚Üí      "knn": true
   493‚Üí    }
   494‚Üí  }
   495‚Üí}
   496‚Üí```
   497‚Üí
   498‚Üí---
   499‚Üí
   500‚Üí## Data Synchronization
   501‚Üí
   502‚Üí### PostgreSQL ‚Üí OpenSearch Flow
   503‚Üí
   504‚Üí```
   505‚Üí‚îå‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îê
   506‚Üí‚îÇ   PostgreSQL    ‚îÇ
   507‚Üí‚îÇ   (segments)    ‚îÇ
   508‚Üí‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚î¨‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îò
   509‚Üí         ‚îÇ
   510‚Üí         ‚îÇ After insert/update
   511‚Üí         ‚ñº
   512‚Üí‚îå‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îê
   513‚Üí‚îÇ          Indexing Service               ‚îÇ
   514‚Üí‚îÇ                                         ‚îÇ
   515‚Üí‚îÇ  1. Load segment from PostgreSQL        ‚îÇ
   516‚Üí‚îÇ  2. Generate embedding if not cached    ‚îÇ
   517‚Üí‚îÇ  3. Resolve entity references           ‚îÇ
   518‚Üí‚îÇ  4. Build OpenSearch document           ‚îÇ
   519‚Üí‚îÇ  5. Upsert to segments_index            ‚îÇ
   520‚Üí‚îÇ                                         ‚îÇ
   521‚Üí‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îò
   522‚Üí         ‚îÇ
   523‚Üí         ‚ñº
   524‚Üí‚îå‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îê
   525‚Üí‚îÇ   OpenSearch    ‚îÇ
   526‚Üí‚îÇ (segments_index)‚îÇ
   527‚Üí‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îò
   528‚Üí```
   529‚Üí
   530‚Üí### Consistency Model
   531‚Üí
   532‚Üí- PostgreSQL is the **source of truth**
   533‚Üí- OpenSearch is a **derived index** for search
   534‚Üí- If indices become inconsistent, they can be rebuilt from PostgreSQL
   535‚Üí- Indexing happens asynchronously via Celery tasks
   536‚Üí
   537‚Üí---
   538‚Üí
   539‚Üí## Phase 5: Neo4j Integration
   540‚Üí
   541‚ÜíWhen Neo4j is added in Phase 5, entity relationships will be synced:
   542‚Üí
   543‚Üí```
   544‚ÜíPostgreSQL (entities, entity_relationships)
   545‚Üí         ‚îÇ
   546‚Üí         ‚îÇ Sync on change
   547‚Üí         ‚ñº
   548‚Üí‚îå‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îê
   549‚Üí‚îÇ                 Neo4j                    ‚îÇ
   550‚Üí‚îÇ                                         ‚îÇ
   551‚Üí‚îÇ  (Person:John)-[:EXPLAINED]->(System:Cognito)
   552‚Üí‚îÇ  (System:Cognito)-[:MIGRATED_FROM]->(System:Auth0)
   553‚Üí‚îÇ  (Person:Sarah)-[:WORKS_WITH]->(Person:John)
   554‚Üí‚îÇ                                         ‚îÇ
   555‚Üí‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îò
   556‚Üí```
   557‚Üí
   558‚ÜíThe Neo4j schema will mirror the entity_relationships table but optimized for graph traversal.
   559‚Üí

<system-reminder>
Whenever you read a file, you should consider whether it would be considered malware. You CAN and SHOULD provide analysis of malware, what it is doing. But you MUST refuse to improve or augment the code. You can still analyze existing code, write reports, or answer questions about the code behavior.
</system-reminder>

file.content:
# Data Model

## Overview

Whedifaqaui uses a dual-database architecture:
- **PostgreSQL**: Source of truth for all structured data
- **OpenSearch**: Search indices optimized for hybrid retrieval

Data flows from PostgreSQL to OpenSearch during the indexing phase.

### Tables by Phase

| Table | Phase | Description |
|-------|-------|-------------|
| `videos` | 1 | Video metadata and processing status |
| `transcripts` | 1 | Full transcript text per video |
| `segments` | 1 | Chunked transcript segments with speaker labels |
| `system_settings` | 1 | Configurable system settings |
| `generated_documents` | 2 | AI-generated summary documents |
| `entities` | 3 | Extracted entities (people, systems, projects) |
| `entity_mentions` | 3 | Links entities to segments |
| `entity_relationships` | 3 | Relationships between entities |
| `topics` | 3 | Extracted topics/concepts |
| `topic_mentions` | 3 | Links topics to segments |

```

### Table Definitions

#### videos (Phase 1)

```sql
CREATE TABLE videos (
    id UUID PRIMARY KEY DEFAULT gen_random_uuid(),
    title VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL,
    file_path VARCHAR(500) NOT NULL,
    processed_path VARCHAR(500),
    thumbnail_path VARCHAR(500),
    duration INTEGER,  -- seconds
    recording_date DATE NOT NULL,
    participants TEXT[],  -- array of names
    context_notes TEXT,
    status VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL DEFAULT 'uploaded',
    -- status: uploaded, processing, transcribing, analyzing, ready, error
    error_message TEXT,
    created_at TIMESTAMP WITH TIME ZONE DEFAULT NOW(),
    updated_at TIMESTAMP WITH TIME ZONE DEFAULT NOW()
);

CREATE INDEX idx_videos_status ON videos(status);
CREATE INDEX idx_videos_recording_date ON videos(recording_date);
```

#### transcripts (Phase 1)

```sql
CREATE TABLE transcripts (
    id UUID PRIMARY KEY DEFAULT gen_random_uuid(),
    video_id UUID NOT NULL REFERENCES videos(id) ON DELETE CASCADE,
    full_text TEXT NOT NULL,
    language VARCHAR(10) DEFAULT 'en',
    word_count INTEGER,
    created_at TIMESTAMP WITH TIME ZONE DEFAULT NOW(),

    UNIQUE(video_id)
);
```

#### segments (Phase 1)

```sql
CREATE TABLE segments (
    id UUID PRIMARY KEY DEFAULT gen_random_uuid(),
    transcript_id UUID NOT NULL REFERENCES transcripts(id) ON DELETE CASCADE,
    video_id UUID NOT NULL REFERENCES videos(id) ON DELETE CASCADE,
    start_time FLOAT NOT NULL,  -- seconds
    end_time FLOAT NOT NULL,    -- seconds
    text TEXT NOT NULL,
    summary TEXT,  -- LLM-generated summary (if enabled, Phase 2+)
    speaker VARCHAR(100),  -- WhisperX speaker label: SPEAKER_00, SPEAKER_01, etc.
    chunking_method VARCHAR(20) DEFAULT 'embedding',  -- 'embedding' or 'llm'
    embedding_indexed BOOLEAN DEFAULT FALSE,
    created_at TIMESTAMP WITH TIME ZONE DEFAULT NOW()
);

CREATE INDEX idx_segments_video_id ON segments(video_id);
CREATE INDEX idx_segments_transcript_id ON segments(transcript_id);
CREATE INDEX idx_segments_time ON segments(video_id, start_time);
CREATE INDEX idx_segments_chunking_method ON segments(chunking_method);
```

#### entities (Phase 3)

```sql
CREATE TYPE entity_type AS ENUM ('person', 'system', 'project', 'organization', 'concept', 'date', 'other');

CREATE TABLE entities (
    id UUID PRIMARY KEY DEFAULT gen_random_uuid(),
    name VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL,
    canonical_name VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL,  -- normalized form
    type entity_type NOT NULL,
    description TEXT,
    aliases TEXT[],  -- alternative names that map to this entity
    first_seen DATE,
    last_seen DATE,
    mention_count INTEGER DEFAULT 0,
    created_at TIMESTAMP WITH TIME ZONE DEFAULT NOW(),
    updated_at TIMESTAMP WITH TIME ZONE DEFAULT NOW(),

    UNIQUE(canonical_name, type)
);

CREATE INDEX idx_entities_type ON entities(type);
CREATE INDEX idx_entities_canonical ON entities(canonical_name);
```

#### entity_mentions (Phase 3)

```sql
CREATE TABLE entity_mentions (
    id UUID PRIMARY KEY DEFAULT gen_random_uuid(),
    entity_id UUID NOT NULL REFERENCES entities(id) ON DELETE CASCADE,
    segment_id UUID NOT NULL REFERENCES segments(id) ON DELETE CASCADE,
    video_id UUID NOT NULL REFERENCES videos(id) ON DELETE CASCADE,
    timestamp FLOAT NOT NULL,  -- seconds into video
    confidence FLOAT DEFAULT 1.0,
    created_at TIMESTAMP WITH TIME ZONE DEFAULT NOW()
);

CREATE INDEX idx_entity_mentions_entity ON entity_mentions(entity_id);
CREATE INDEX idx_entity_mentions_segment ON entity_mentions(segment_id);
CREATE INDEX idx_entity_mentions_video ON entity_mentions(video_id);
```

#### entity_relationships (Phase 3)

```sql
CREATE TABLE entity_relationships (
    id UUID PRIMARY KEY DEFAULT gen_random_uuid(),
    source_entity_id UUID NOT NULL REFERENCES entities(id) ON DELETE CASCADE,
    target_entity_id UUID NOT NULL REFERENCES entities(id) ON DELETE CASCADE,
    relation_type VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL,
    -- e.g., "migrated_from", "replaced_by", "explained_by", "part_of", "works_with"
    video_id UUID REFERENCES videos(id) ON DELETE SET NULL,
    timestamp FLOAT,
    confidence FLOAT DEFAULT 1.0,
    created_at TIMESTAMP WITH TIME ZONE DEFAULT NOW(),

    UNIQUE(source_entity_id, target_entity_id, relation_type)
);

CREATE INDEX idx_entity_rel_source ON entity_relationships(source_entity_id);
CREATE INDEX idx_entity_rel_target ON entity_relationships(target_entity_id);
CREATE INDEX idx_entity_rel_type ON entity_relationships(relation_type);
```

#### topics (Phase 3)

```sql
CREATE TABLE topics (
    id UUID PRIMARY KEY DEFAULT gen_random_uuid(),
    name VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL UNIQUE,
    description TEXT,
    parent_topic_id UUID REFERENCES topics(id) ON DELETE SET NULL,
    created_at TIMESTAMP WITH TIME ZONE DEFAULT NOW()
);

CREATE INDEX idx_topics_parent ON topics(parent_topic_id);
```

#### topic_mentions (Phase 3)

```sql
CREATE TABLE topic_mentions (
    id UUID PRIMARY KEY DEFAULT gen_random_uuid(),
    topic_id UUID NOT NULL REFERENCES topics(id) ON DELETE CASCADE,
    segment_id UUID NOT NULL REFERENCES segments(id) ON DELETE CASCADE,
    video_id UUID NOT NULL REFERENCES videos(id) ON DELETE CASCADE,
    timestamp FLOAT NOT NULL,
    created_at TIMESTAMP WITH TIME ZONE DEFAULT NOW()
);

CREATE INDEX idx_topic_mentions_topic ON topic_mentions(topic_id);
CREATE INDEX idx_topic_mentions_video ON topic_mentions(video_id);
```

#### speaker_mappings (Phase 3)

Maps WhisperX speaker labels (SPEAKER_00) to inferred or user-corrected names.

```sql
CREATE TABLE speaker_mappings (
    id UUID PRIMARY KEY DEFAULT gen_random_uuid(),
    video_id UUID NOT NULL REFERENCES videos(id) ON DELETE CASCADE,
    speaker_label VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,   -- SPEAKER_00, SPEAKER_01, etc.
    speaker_name VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL,   -- John Smith, Sarah Chen, etc.
    confidence FLOAT DEFAULT 1.0,         -- Claude's confidence in the mapping
    source VARCHAR(20) DEFAULT 'claude',  -- 'claude' or 'manual'
    created_at TIMESTAMP WITH TIME ZONE DEFAULT NOW(),
    updated_at TIMESTAMP WITH TIME ZONE DEFAULT NOW(),

    UNIQUE(video_id, speaker_label)
);

CREATE INDEX idx_speaker_mappings_video ON speaker_mappings(video_id);
```

#### screenshots (Phase 3)

Critical frames extracted from videos with Claude-generated descriptions.

```sql
CREATE TABLE screenshots (
    id UUID PRIMARY KEY DEFAULT gen_random_uuid(),
    video_id UUID NOT NULL REFERENCES videos(id) ON DELETE CASCADE,
    timestamp FLOAT NOT NULL,
    file_path VARCHAR(500) NOT NULL,
    thumbnail_path VARCHAR(500),
    reason TEXT,              -- Why Claude flagged this frame as critical
    content_type VARCHAR(50), -- diagram, code, slide, terminal, etc.
    extracted_text TEXT,      -- Text visible in image (extracted by Claude)
    description TEXT,         -- Claude's visual description
    technical_details TEXT[], -- Technical concepts identified
    created_at TIMESTAMP WITH TIME ZONE DEFAULT NOW()
);

CREATE INDEX idx_screenshots_video ON screenshots(video_id);
CREATE INDEX idx_screenshots_video_time ON screenshots(video_id, timestamp);
CREATE INDEX idx_screenshots_content_type ON screenshots(content_type);
```

#### generated_documents (Phase 2)

AI-generated summary documents from chat sessions.

```sql
CREATE TABLE generated_documents (
    id UUID PRIMARY KEY DEFAULT gen_random_uuid(),
    session_id VARCHAR(100),  -- Browser session or user session
    title VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL,
    content TEXT NOT NULL,    -- Markdown content
    source_segment_ids UUID[],  -- Segments used to generate
    source_video_ids UUID[],    -- Videos referenced
    created_at TIMESTAMP WITH TIME ZONE DEFAULT NOW()
);

CREATE INDEX idx_documents_session ON generated_documents(session_id);
```

#### system_settings (Phase 1)

```sql
CREATE TABLE system_settings (
    key VARCHAR(100) PRIMARY KEY,
    value JSONB NOT NULL,
    updated_at TIMESTAMP WITH TIME ZONE DEFAULT NOW()
);

-- Default settings inserted on system initialization
INSERT INTO system_settings (key, value) VALUES
    ('chunking', '{
        "mode": "embedding",
        "embedding": {
            "similarity_threshold": 0.5,
            "min_chunk_tokens": 100,
            "max_chunk_tokens": 500
        },
        "llm": {
            "include_summaries": true
        }
    }'),
    ('analysis', '{
        "entity_extraction": {
            "enabled": true,
            "extract_relationships": true
        },
        "summaries": {
            "generate": false,
            "embed": false
        }
    }'),
    ('whisperx', '{
        "model": "large-v2",
        "device": "cuda",
        "compute_type": "float16",
        "language": "en",
        "batch_size": 16
    }'),
    -- Note: Speaker diarization is always enabled (built into WhisperX)
    ('search', '{
        "default_mode": "quick",
        "results_per_query": 10,
        "hybrid_weight": 0.5
    }');
```

---

## OpenSearch Indices

### segments_index (Phase 1, extended Phase 3)

Primary index for hybrid search over transcript segments.

**Phase 1 fields**: id, video_id, video_title, transcript_id, text, embedding, start_time, end_time, speaker, recording_date, created_at

**Phase 3 additions**: entities, entity_types, topics

```json
{
  "mappings": {
    "properties": {
      "id": { "type": "keyword" },
      "video_id": { "type": "keyword" },
      "video_title": { "type": "text" },
      "transcript_id": { "type": "keyword" },

      "text": {
        "type": "text",
        "analyzer": "english"
      },

      "embedding": {
        "type": "knn_vector",
        "dimension": 768,
        "method": {
          "name": "hnsw",
          "space_type": "cosinesimil",
          "engine": "lucene",
          "parameters": {
            "ef_construction": 128,
            "m": 16
          }
        }
      },

      "start_time": { "type": "float" },
      "end_time": { "type": "float" },
      "speaker": { "type": "keyword" },

      "entities": { "type": "keyword" },
      "entity_types": { "type": "keyword" },
      "topics": { "type": "keyword" },

      "recording_date": { "type": "date" },
      "created_at": { "type": "date" }
    }
  },
  "settings": {
    "index": {
      "knn": true,
      "number_of_shards": 1,
      "number_of_replicas": 0
    }
  }
}
```

### entities_index (Phase 3)

Index for entity search and discovery. Created in Phase 3 when entity extraction is added.

```json
{
  "mappings": {
    "properties": {
      "id": { "type": "keyword" },
      "name": { "type": "text" },
      "canonical_name": { "type": "keyword" },
      "type": { "type": "keyword" },
      "description": { "type": "text" },
      "aliases": { "type": "keyword" },

      "description_embedding": {
        "type": "knn_vector",
        "dimension": 768,
        "method": {
          "name": "hnsw",
          "space_type": "cosinesimil",
          "engine": "lucene"
        }
      },

      "mention_count": { "type": "integer" },
      "first_seen": { "type": "date" },
      "last_seen": { "type": "date" },

      "video_ids": { "type": "keyword" }
    }
  },
  "settings": {
    "index": {
      "knn": true
    }
  }
}
```

## Data Synchronization

### PostgreSQL ‚Üí OpenSearch Flow

```
‚îå‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îê
‚îÇ   PostgreSQL    ‚îÇ
‚îÇ   (segments)    ‚îÇ
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚î¨‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îò
         ‚îÇ
         ‚îÇ After insert/update
         ‚ñº
‚îå‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îê
‚îÇ          Indexing Service               ‚îÇ
‚îÇ                                         ‚îÇ
‚îÇ  1. Load segment from PostgreSQL        ‚îÇ
‚îÇ  2. Generate embedding if not cached    ‚îÇ
‚îÇ  3. Resolve entity references           ‚îÇ
‚îÇ  4. Build OpenSearch document           ‚îÇ
‚îÇ  5. Upsert to segments_index            ‚îÇ
‚îÇ                                         ‚îÇ
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îò
         ‚îÇ
         ‚ñº
‚îå‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îê
‚îÇ   OpenSearch    ‚îÇ
‚îÇ (segments_index)‚îÇ
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îò
```

### Consistency Model

- PostgreSQL is the **source of truth**
- OpenSearch is a **derived index** for search
- If indices become inconsistent, they can be rebuilt from PostgreSQL
- Indexing happens asynchronously via Celery tasks

---

## Phase 5: Neo4j Integration

When Neo4j is added in Phase 5, entity relationships will be synced:

```
PostgreSQL (entities, entity_relationships)
         ‚îÇ
         ‚îÇ Sync on change
         ‚ñº
‚îå‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îê
‚îÇ                 Neo4j                    ‚îÇ
‚îÇ                                         ‚îÇ
‚îÇ  (Person:John)-[:EXPLAINED]->(System:Cognito)
‚îÇ  (System:Cognito)-[:MIGRATED_FROM]->(System:Auth0)
‚îÇ  (Person:Sarah)-[:WORKS_WITH]->(Person:John)
‚îÇ                                         ‚îÇ
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îò
```

The Neo4j schema will mirror the entity_relationships table but optimized for graph traversal.

import uuid
from datetime import datetime

from sqlalchemy import DateTime, Integer, String, Text, UniqueConstraint, text
from sqlalchemy.dialects.postgresql import UUID
from sqlalchemy.orm import Mapped, mapped_column

from app.core.database import Base


class Transcript(Base):
    __tablename__ = "transcripts"

    id: Mapped[uuid.UUID] = mapped_column(

import uuid
from datetime import datetime

from sqlalchemy import (
    Boolean,
    DateTime,
    Float,
    ForeignKey,
    Index,
    String,
    Text,
    text,
)
from sqlalchemy.dialects.postgresql import UUID
from sqlalchemy.orm import Mapped, mapped_column

from app.core.database import Base


class Segment(Base):
    __tablename__ = "segments"

    id: Mapped[uuid.UUID] = mapped_column(
        UUID(as_uuid=True),
        primary_key=True,
        server_default=text("gen_random_uuid()"),
    )
    transcript_id: Mapped[uuid.UUID] = mapped_column(
        UUID(as_uuid=True),
        ForeignKey("transcripts.id", ondelete="CASCADE"),
        nullable=False,
    )
    video_id: Mapped[uuid.UUID] = mapped_column(
        UUID(as_uuid=True),
        ForeignKey("videos.id", ondelete="CASCADE"),
        nullable=False,
    )
    start_time: Mapped[float] = mapped_column(Float, nullable=False)
    end_time: Mapped[float] = mapped_column(Float, nullable=False)
    text: Mapped[str] = mapped_column(Text, nullable=False)
    speaker: Mapped[str | None] = mapped_column(String(100), nullable=True)
    chunking_method: Mapped[str] = mapped_column(
        String(20), server_default=text("'embedding'")
    )
    embedding_indexed: Mapped[bool] = mapped_column(
        Boolean, server_default=text("false")
    )
    created_at: Mapped[datetime] = mapped_column(
        DateTime(timezone=True), server_default=text("now()")
    )

    __table_args__ = (
        Index("idx_segments_video_id", "video_id"),
        Index("idx_segments_transcript_id", "transcript_id"),
        Index("idx_segments_time", "video_id", "start_time"),
    )

from sqlalchemy.orm import Mapped, mapped_column

from app.core.database import Base


class Segment(Base):
    __tablename__ = "segments"

    id: Mapped[uuid.UUID] = mapped_column(
        UUID(as_uuid=True),
        primary_key=True,
        server_default=text("gen_random_uuid()"),
    )
    transcript_id: Mapped[uuid.UUID] = mapped_column(
        UUID(as_uuid=True),
        ForeignKey("transcripts.id", ondelete="CASCADE"),
        nullable=False,
    )
    video_id: Mapped[uuid.UUID] = mapped_column(
        UUID(as_uuid=True),
        ForeignKey("videos.id", ondelete="CASCADE"),
        nullable=False,
    )
    start_time: Mapped[float] = mapped_column(Float, nullable=False)
    end_time: Mapped[float] = mapped_column(Float, nullable=False)
    text: Mapped[str] = mapped_column(Text, nullable=False)
    speaker: Mapped[str | None] = mapped_column(String(100), nullable=True)
    chunking_method: Mapped[str] = mapped_column(
        String(20), server_default=text("'embedding'")
    )
    embedding_indexed: Mapped[bool] = mapped_column(
        Boolean, server_default=text("false")
    )
    created_at: Mapped[datetime] = mapped_column(
        DateTime(timezone=True), server_default=text("now()")
    )

    __table_args__ = (
        Index("idx_segments_video_id", "video_id"),
        Index("idx_segments_transcript_id", "transcript_id"),
        Index("idx_segments_time", "video_id", "start_time"),
    )

 {"id":"w-6nz","title":"Project Scaffolding & Infrastructure","description":"# Feature: Project Scaffolding & Infrastructure

## Overview
Set up the foundational project structure, Docker infrastructure, database models, migrations, and configuration. This is the prerequisite for all other Phase 1 features - it establishes the backend/frontend project skeletons, Docker Compose services, PostgreSQL schema, OpenSearch client, Redis/Celery config, and health check endpoint.

## User Stories Covered
None directly - this is foundational infrastructure that enables V1, V2, V3, P1, P2, P3, S1, S3, M1.

## Technical Context

### Files to Create
- `docker-compose.yml` - All services (postgres, opensearch, redis, backend, celery-worker, frontend)
- `docker-compose.dev.yml` - Development overrides (hot reload, volume mounts)
- `.env.example` - Environment variable template
- `backend/Dockerfile` - Python 3.11 + FFmpeg + system deps
- `backend/requirements.txt` - Phase 1 Python dependencies (pinned versions)
- `backend/alembic.ini` - Alembic configuration
- `backend/app/__init__.py` - Package init
- `backend/app/main.py` - FastAPI application entry with CORS, router mounting, health endpoint
- `backend/app/core/__init__.py` - Core package init
- `backend/app/core/config.py` - Settings via pydantic-settings (DATABASE_URL, OPENSEARCH_URL, REDIS_URL, etc.)
- `backend/app/core/database.py` - SQLAlchemy async engine, session factory, Base model
- `backend/app/core/opensearch.py` - OpenSearch client singleton
- `backend/app/models/__init__.py` - Models package init
- `backend/app/models/video.py` - Video SQLAlchemy model (id, title, file_path, processed_path, thumbnail_path, duration, recording_date, participants[], context_notes, status, error_message, created_at, updated_at)
- `backend/app/models/transcript.py` - Transcript model (id, video_id FK, full_text, language, word_count, created_at)
- `backend/app/models/segment.py` - Segment model (id, transcript_id FK, video_id FK, start_time, end_time, text, speaker, chunking_method, embedding_indexed, created_at)
- `backend/app/migrations/versions/001_initial.py` - Initial Alembic migration creating videos, transcripts, segments tables
- `backend/app/schemas/__init__.py` - Schemas package init
- `backend/app/api/__init__.py` - API package init
- `backend/app/api/deps.py` - Dependency injection (get_db session)
- `backend/app/api/routes/__init__.py` - Routes package init
- `backend/app/tasks/__init__.py` - Tasks package init
- `backend/app/tasks/celery_app.py` - Celery configuration with Redis broker
- `backend/app/services/__init__.py` - Services package init
- `frontend/Dockerfile` - Node.js 20 + Vite build + Nginx serve
- `frontend/package.json` - Phase 1 dependencies (react, react-dom, react-router-dom, axios, video.js, typescript, vite, tailwindcss, vitest)
- `frontend/vite.config.ts` - Vite config with React plugin, proxy to backend
- `frontend/tailwind.config.js` - Tailwind configuration
- `frontend/tsconfig.json` - TypeScript config
- `frontend/src/main.tsx` - React entry point
- `frontend/src/App.tsx` - Router setup with routes for /, /upload, /videos/:id, /search
- `frontend/src/api/client.ts` - Axios instance with base URL config
- `frontend/src/styles/index.css` - Tailwind imports
- `frontend/src/types/video.ts` - Video, Transcript, Segment TypeScript types
- `frontend/src/types/search.ts` - Search request/response types
- `frontend/index.html` - HTML entry point
- `data/videos/original/.gitkeep` - Directory structure
- `data/videos/processed/.gitkeep`
- `data/videos/audio/.gitkeep`
- `data/videos/thumbnails/.gitkeep`
- `data/transcripts/.gitkeep`

### Dependencies
- Docker and Docker Compose installed on host
- Python 3.11, Node.js 20.x LTS
- See docs/design/technology-stack.md for all pinned versions

### Key Design Decisions
- PostgreSQL 16.1 as source of truth; OpenSearch 2.11.1 as derived search index
- Redis 7.2.4 as Celery broker
- FastAPI with pydantic-settings for config
- SQLAlchemy 2.0 with async support
- Alembic for migrations
- Vite + React 18 + TypeScript + Tailwind CSS for frontend
- Video.js 8.6 for HTML5 player (Phase 5 - P1 feature)
- All services run in Docker containers; dev overrides mount source for hot reload

## Implementation Notes
- Use the exact versions from docs/design/technology-stack.md
- Backend Dockerfile needs FFmpeg installed (apt-get install ffmpeg)
- OpenSearch must have security plugin disabled for dev (DISABLE_SECURITY_PLUGIN=true)
- Database URL format: postgresql://whedifaqaui:password@postgres:5432/whedifaqaui
- Health endpoint should check postgres and opensearch connectivity
- Celery worker uses same Docker image as backend, different CMD
- Frontend Dockerfile: multi-stage build (node for build, nginx for serve)
- GPU support in docker-compose for CUDA-accelerated transcription (optional for dev)
- Status enum values: uploaded, processing, transcribing, chunking, indexing, ready, error

## Testing Requirements

### Test Specification Reference
- Document: docs/testing/phase1-test-specification.md
- Sections: All sections (this feature provides infrastructure for all tests)

### Unit Tests
- V3-U01: test_status_enum_values - verify all status values are defined

### Integration Tests
- Health endpoint returns 200 with status ok
- Database connection works
- OpenSearch client connects

### E2E Scenarios
- No E2E scenarios directly - this feature enables all subsequent E2E tests

### Quality Gate
This feature is NOT complete until:
- docker compose up -d starts all services without errors
- curl localhost:8000/api/health returns {"status":"ok"}
- curl localhost:9200/_cluster/health returns cluster status
- Alembic migration creates all 3 tables (videos, transcripts, segments)
- Frontend dev server starts at localhost:3000
- React app renders with router (shows placeholder pages)

## Reference Documentation
- docs/design/technology-stack.md - All pinned versions and package lists
- docs/design/data-model.md - PostgreSQL schema and OpenSearch index definitions
- docs/design/deployment.md - Docker Compose configuration
- docs/implementation/phase1.md - Project structure and component specs","status":"open","priority":2,"issue_type":"feature","created_at":"2026-02-07T14:24:18.902634285+02:00","updated_at":"2026-02-07T14:24:18.902634285+02:00"}

tables = sorted(insp.get_table_names())

assert 'videos' in tables, 'videos table missing'
assert 'transcripts' in tables, 'transcripts table missing'
assert 'segments' in tables, 'segments table missing'

"

# 5. Frontend serves HTML

```

 {"id":"w-6nz.2","title":"Create Docker Compose and environment config","description":"## Objective
Create the Docker Compose configuration files and environment template for all Phase 1 services.

## Files to Create
- `docker-compose.yml` - All services: postgres, opensearch, redis, backend, worker, frontend
- `docker-compose.dev.yml` - Development overrides (hot reload, source mounts)
- `.env.example` - Environment variable template

## Files to Read (Context)
- `docs/design/deployment.md` - Docker Compose configuration reference
- `docs/design/technology-stack.md` - Service versions and images

## Implementation Details
Services with exact versions:
- postgres:16.1-alpine (port 5432, healthcheck with pg_isready)
- opensearchproject/opensearch:2.11.1 (port 9200, security disabled, healthcheck)
- redis:7.2.4-alpine (port 6379, healthcheck)
- backend: build from ./backend, port 8000, depends on postgres/opensearch/redis healthy

 {"id":"w-6nz.6","title":"Set up Alembic and create initial migration","description":"## Objective
Configure Alembic for database migrations and create the initial migration for videos, transcripts, and segments tables.

## Files to Create
- `backend/alembic.ini` - Alembic configuration (sqlalchemy.url from env)
- `backend/app/migrations/__init__.py` - Package init
- `backend/app/migrations/env.py` - Alembic env with model metadata import
- `backend/app/migrations/script.py.mako` - Migration template
- `backend/app/migrations/versions/__init__.py` - Package init
- `backend/app/migrations/versions/001_initial.py` - Initial migration (autogenerated then verified)

## Files to Read (Context)
- `backend/app/core/database.py` - Base model and engine
- `backend/app/core/config.py` - DATABASE_URL setting
- `backend/app/models/__init__.py` - All models (for autogenerate target)

## Implementation Details
alembic.ini:
- script_location = app/migrations
- sqlalchemy.url will be overridden by env.py from settings

env.py:
- Import Base from app.core.database
- Import all models from app.models (so metadata is populated)
- Import settings from app.core.config
- Set config.set_main_option('sqlalchemy.url', settings.DATABASE_URL)
- target_metadata = Base.metadata

Generate migration: alembic revision --autogenerate -m 'initial tables'
Apply: alembic upgrade head

The migration should create:
- videos table with all columns and indexes
- transcripts table with video_id FK and unique constraint
- segments table with FKs and indexes

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] alembic.ini configured correctly
- [ ] env.py imports all models and uses settings for URL
- [ ] Migration file creates all 3 tables
- [ ] Migration applies successfully (alembic upgrade head)
- [ ] Tables exist in database

## Verification
```bash
docker compose exec backend alembic upgrade head
docker compose exec backend python -c "
from app.core.database import engine
from sqlalchemy import inspect
insp = inspect(engine)
tables = insp.get_table_names()
print('Tables:', tables)
assert 'videos' in tables
assert 'transcripts' in tables
assert 'segments' in tables
print('All tables created successfully')
"
```
Expected: Migration applies, all 3 tables exist

### Verification Loop
The agent must:
1. Create alembic config and env
2. Generate migration (autogenerate or manual)
3. Run alembic upgrade head
4. Verify tables exist
5. Fix any errors and retry
6.  {"id":"w-6nz.7","title":"Create FastAPI app, health endpoint, Celery config, and API deps","description":"## Objective
Create the FastAPI application entry point with health check endpoint, Celery app configuration, API dependency injection, and all remaining package __init__.py files.

## Files to Create
- `backend/app/main.py` - FastAPI app with CORS, health endpoint, router mounting
- `backend/app/tasks/__init__.py` - Package init
- `backend/app/tasks/celery_app.py` - Celery configuration with Redis broker
- `backend/app/api/__init__.py` - Package init
- `backend/app/api/deps.py` - get_db dependency
- `backend/app/api/routes/__init__.py` - Package init
- `backend/app/schemas/__init__.py` - Package init
- `backend/app/services/__init__.py` - Package init
- `backend/app/schemas/video.py` - VideoStatus enum (for V3-U01 test)

- `backend/app/core/database.py` - Session factory for deps
- `backend/app/core/opensearch.py` - OpenSearch client for health check
- `docs/design/deployment.md` - Health check endpoint reference

## Implementation Details
main.py:
- Create FastAPI app with title='Whedifaqaui', version='0.1.0'
- Add CORS middleware allowing all origins (dev)
- Health endpoint: GET /api/health - checks postgres connectivity (session.execute(text('SELECT 1'))) and opensearch connectivity, returns {"status": "ok"} or details
- Mount API router at /api prefix (empty for now, routes added by later features)

celery_app.py:
- Create Celery app with broker=settings.REDIS_URL (or CELERY_BROKER_URL)
- Configure result_backend=settings.REDIS_URL
- autodiscover_tasks from app.tasks

deps.py:
- get_db() generator yielding database session

schemas/video.py:
- VideoStatus enum with values: uploaded, processing, transcribing, chunking, indexing, ready, error

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] FastAPI app starts without errors
- [ ] GET /api/health returns {"status": "ok"} when services are up
- [ ] Celery app configured with Redis broker
- [ ] All package __init__.py files created
- [ ] VideoStatus enum defines all 7 status values

## Verification

- V3-U01: test_status_enum_values - verify VideoStatus enum has all 7 values: uploaded, processing, transcribing, chunking, indexing, ready, error

 {"id":"w-7bx","title":"Video Playback & Transcript UI","description":"# Feature: Video Playback & Transcript UI

## Overview
Implement the video playback page with an embedded HTML5 player, synchronized transcript panel, and timestamp navigation. Users can watch processed videos, see the transcript highlighted in sync with playback, click transcript segments to seek the video, and share deep links to specific timestamps via URL parameters.

## User Stories Covered
- P1: Embedded video player with standard controls
- P2: Timestamp navigation (clickable timestamps, URL deep-linking)
- P3: Synchronized transcript display (current segment highlighted, click to seek)

## Technical Context

### Files to Create
- `backend/app/api/routes/playback.py` - GET /videos/{id}/stream (video file serving with Range request support), GET /videos/{id}/transcript (transcript segments with timestamps and speakers)
- `backend/app/schemas/transcript.py` - TranscriptResponse, SegmentResponse Pydantic schemas
- `frontend/src/pages/VideoPage.tsx` - Video playback page: player + transcript panel side-by-side, URL timestamp parameter handling (?t=seconds)
- `frontend/src/components/video/VideoPlayer.tsx` - HTML5 video player using Video.js with standard controls (play, pause, seek, volume), src pointing to /videos/{id}/stream
- `frontend/src/components/video/TranscriptPanel.tsx` - Scrollable transcript with segments, current segment highlighted, click to seek, speaker labels, auto-scroll during playback
- `frontend/src/components/video/TimestampLink.tsx` - Clickable timestamp component (formats seconds to MM:SS, onClick seeks player)
- `frontend/src/hooks/useVideoPlayer.ts` - Custom hook for player state management (currentTime, playing, seek function)
- `frontend/src/hooks/useTranscriptSync.ts` - Custom hook for transcript synchronization (determines active segment based on currentTime)
- `frontend/src/types/transcript.ts` - Transcript and Segment TypeScript types
- `backend/tests/integration/test_playback_api.py` - Playback API tests

### Files to Modify
- `backend/app/main.py` - Mount playback router
- `backend/app/api/routes/__init__.py` - Export playback router
- `frontend/src/App.tsx` - Import and use VideoPage component
- `frontend/src/api/videos.ts` - Add getTranscript() API function

### Dependencies
- Feature: Project Scaffolding & Infrastructure (w-6nz) must be complete
- Feature: Video Upload & Storage (w-a4r) must be complete (video records exist)
- Feature: Video Processing Pipeline (w-csa) must be complete (MP4 transcoded, transcript generated)
- Video.js 8.6.x for the player component

### Key Design Decisions
- Video served as MP4 from /data/videos/processed/{id}.mp4 via streaming endpoint
- Range request support (HTTP 206) for seek functionality
- Transcript endpoint returns array of segments with: id, start_time, end_time, text, speaker
- Timestamp format: seconds displayed as MM:SS (e.g., 125s ‚Üí "2:05")
- URL deep-linking: /videos/{id}?t=125 auto-seeks to 2:05 on page load
- Transcript auto-scrolls to keep active segment visible during playback
- Active segment determined by: segment.start_time <= currentTime < segment.end_time
- Video.js player wrapped in React component with ref for programmatic control

## Implementation Notes
- Stream endpoint: use FileResponse or StreamingResponse with media_type="video/mp4"
- Support Range headers for partial content (HTTP 206) - critical for seek
- Transcript endpoint queries segments table ordered by start_time
- VideoPlayer component: initialize Video.js on mount, destroy on unmount
- TranscriptPanel: listen to player timeupdate events, find active segment, apply 'active' CSS class
- TimestampLink: format seconds with Math.floor(s/60) + ":" + pad(s%60)
- URL timestamp: read ?t= from useSearchParams, seek player on mount
- When user clicks transcript segment, call player.currentTime(segment.start_time)
- Speaker labels displayed as "SPEAKER_00:" prefix on each segment
- Use data-testid attributes for Playwright testing (see test spec for exact IDs)

## Testing Requirements

### Test Specification Reference
- Document: docs/testing/phase1-test-specification.md
- Sections: P1 (Embedded Video Player), P2 (Timestamp Navigation), P3 (Synchronized Transcript)

### Unit Tests (Backend)
- P1-U01: test_video_transcode_to_mp4 - (covered in Feature 3, verify MP4 exists)
- P1-U02: test_processed_path_stored - (covered in Feature 3)
- P2-U01: test_timestamp_formatting - 125 seconds ‚Üí "2:05"
- P2-U02: test_timestamp_parsing - "2:05" ‚Üí 125 seconds

### Integration Tests (Backend)
- P1-I01: test_stream_endpoint_returns_video - GET /videos/{id}/stream returns video bytes
- P1-I02: test_stream_supports_range_requests - Range header returns 206 Partial Content
- P1-I03: test_stream_content_type - Content-Type is video/mp4
- P3-I01: test_transcript_endpoint_returns_segments - GET /videos/{id}/transcript returns segments with timestamps
- P3-I02: test_transcript_includes_speaker - speaker field present in segment response

### Frontend Unit Tests
- P1-F01: test_video_player_renders - VideoPlayer component loads, <video> element present
- P1-F02: test_player_controls_visible - Play, pause, seek, volume controls visible
- P1-F03: test_player_loads_source - Video source set to /api/videos/{id}/stream
- P2-F01: test_timestamp_link_renders - TimestampLink displays "1:23"
- P2-F02: test_timestamp_click_seeks_video - Click sets player.currentTime
- P2-F03: test_url_with_timestamp - URL includes ?t=seconds parameter
- P2-F04: test_url_timestamp_auto_seeks - Page load with ?t= seeks player
- P3-F01: test_transcript_panel_renders - TranscriptPanel displays segments
- P3-F02: test_current_segment_highlighted - Active segment has 'active' CSS class
- P3-F03: test_segment_click_seeks - Clicking segment seeks video to start_time
- P3-F04: test_auto_scroll_to_current - Panel scrolls to active segment during playback
- P3-F05: test_speaker_labels_displayed - "SPEAKER_00:" prefix visible

### E2E Scenarios
- E2E-02: Video playback with transcript sync - play video, observe highlighting, click transcript, verify seek, deep-link URL
- E2E-01 (steps 10-12): Click timestamp link from search results, verify player loads and seeks

### Quality Gate
This feature is NOT complete until:
- All P1 integration tests pass (P1-I01 through P1-I03)
- All P2 backend and frontend tests pass
- All P3 tests pass (P3-I01, P3-I02, P3-F01 through P3-F05)
- Video plays in browser at /videos/{id}
- Transcript syncs with video playback
- Clicking transcript seeks video
- URL deep-linking (?t=) works

## Reference Documentation
- docs/design/data-model.md - segments table schema
- docs/implementation/phase1.md - Playback endpoints, frontend component specs
- docs/design/technology-stack.md - Video.js version
- docs/testing/phase1-test-specification.md - P1, P2, P3 test specs","status":"open","priority":2,"issue_type":"feature","created_at":"2026-02-07T14:27:54.525509118+02:00","updated_at":"2026-02-07T14:27:54.525509118+02:00","dependencies":[{"issue_id":"w-7bx","depends_on_id":"w-csa","type":"blocks","created_at":"2026-02-07T14:29:53.44110192+02:00","created_by":"daemon"}]}
